etymology.description: Pictogram—possibly an entrance to a cave or a door flap; conservative form 𠕉; see also 奐 and the top component of 罙.
etymology.interpretation: Graphic of a covered opening suggesting the mouth of a cave or a hanging flap over an entrance. Early shapes like 𠕉 emphasize a shaded or screened hole, matching the meanings “cave; hole.”

examples.chinese: 狐狸躲在地穴里(狐狸躲在地穴裡)。
examples.english: The fox hides in a burrow.

examples.chinese: 他在墙上钻了一个小穴(他在牆上鑽了一個小穴)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài qiáng shàng zuān le yí gè xiǎo xué.
examples.english: He drilled a small hole in the wall.

examples.chinese: 考古队发现了古人的岩穴(考古隊發現了古人的岩穴)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ duì fāxiàn le gǔrén de yánxué.
examples.english: The archaeology team discovered a rock cave used by ancient people.
